physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. The photograph features a man and a woman, sitting on a ledge by a patch of grass. Behind them, there is a view of the ocean. The man is wearing a white shirt and shorts, while the woman is dressed in a mid-length dress. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of Corporal A. Silver  with man sitting by the sea
